title: Learning to Reason over Scene Graphs: A Case Study of Finetuning GPT-2 into a Robot Language Model for Grounded Task Planning. (arXiv:2305.07716v1 [cs.RO])
abstract: Long-horizon task planning is essential for the development of intelligent assistive and service robots. In this work, we investigate the applicability of a smaller class of large language models (LLMs), specifically GPT-2, in robotic task planning by learning to decompose tasks into subgoal specifications for a planner to execute sequentially. Our method grounds the input of the LLM on the domain that is represented as a scene graph, enabling it to translate human requests into executable robot plans, thereby learning to reason over long-horizon tasks, as encountered in the ALFRED benchmark. We compare our approach with classical planning and baseline methods to examine the applicability and generalizability of LLM-based planners. Our findings suggest that the knowledge stored in an LLM can be effectively grounded to perform long-horizon task planning, demonstrating the promising potential for the future application of neuro-symbolic planning methods in robotics.

translated_title: 学习在场景图上推理：将 GPT-2 微调为机器人语言模型以进行基于场景的任务规划的案例研究
translated_abstract: 长程任务规划对于智能辅助和服务机器人的开发至关重要。本文研究了一种更小类别的大型语言模型（LLMs），即GPT-2，在机器人任务规划中的适用性，通过将任务学习分解为子目标规范，为执行者顺序执行。我们的方法将LLM的输入接地于表示为场景图的域上，使其能够将人类请求翻译成可执行的机器人计划，从而学习推理长期任务，如在ALFRED基准测试所遇到的任务。我们将我们的方法与经典规划和基线方法进行比较，以考察基于LLM的计划器的适用性和普适性。我们的发现表明，存储在LLM中的知识可以有效地接地以执行长程任务规划，展示了神经符号规划方法在机器人领域未来应用的潜力。
tldr: 本文研究将GPT-2微调为机器人语言模型的方法，能够通过学习推理将任务分解为子目标规范并顺序执行。使用场景图进行输入接地，该方法能够将人类请求转化为可执行的机器人计划，有效地执行长程任务规划。
en_tdlr: This paper investigates the applicability of using a smaller class of large language models (LLMs), specifically GPT-2, in robotic task planning through learning to decompose tasks into subgoal specifications and grounding the input on a scene graph. The findings suggest that this method effectively performs long-horizon task planning and has the potential for future application in neuro-symbolic planning methods for robotics.
